aslib.time

Class TimeBetween

  • java.lang.Object
    • aslib.time.TimeBetween

  • public class TimeBetween
extends java.lang.Object

    Contains the functions to calculate the difference between two dates.

    Since:
    6.0
    Version:
    2019-07-12
    Author:
    Adriano Siqueira

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimeBetween

        public TimeBetween(java.time.LocalDate startDate,
                   java.time.LocalDate endDate)

        Creates an instance of TimeBetween class.

        Parameters:
        startDate - Start date for processing. If it comes after the end date, the result will be negative.
        endDate - End date for processing.

    • Method Detail

      • getCompleteTime

        public java.util.Map<java.time.temporal.ChronoUnit,java.lang.Integer> getCompleteTime()
                                                                               throws java.lang.NullPointerException

        Calculates the difference between dates, including years, months and days.

        Each field corresponds to an integer that complements.

        The DAY field complements the MONTH field, which complements the YEAR field.

        Returns:
        A map with the fields as key and the values.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If some of the dates are null.

      • getTotalYears

        public int getTotalYears()
                  throws java.lang.NullPointerException

        Calculates the amount of years between the dates.

        Returns:
        The amount of years between the dates.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If some of the dates are null.

      • getTotalMonths

        public long getTotalMonths()
                    throws java.lang.NullPointerException

        Calculates the amount of months between the dates.

        Returns:
        The amount of months between the dates.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If some of the dates are null.

      • calculatePeriod

        private java.time.Period calculatePeriod()

        Calculates the amount time between the dates and keeps it ready to read the data as needed..

        Returns:
        Period calculated with the dates provided.
